description: This schema defines the metadata for a single document as specified by the dms-exchange-specification.
title: dms-exchange-specification (dxs) metadata description

___location.description: Physical location of the scanned documents, if available

___optionOcr.description: Should the document be analyzed or not.

___optionIndexed.description: Should the document be shown in the index (if using a search), or only when the user navigates to the document explicitly.

___documentFiles.description: Groups the document-files in the given order that form a document.

___rotation.description: Degree the document-file has to rotate clockwise to have a correct orientation.

___addedTime.description: Timestamp when the revision of the document-file has been added or changed.

___addedBy.description: User who has added or changed the revision.

___filename.description: Name of the indexed document-file inside the container.

___directory.description: If the dms works hierarchically, this field contains the directory. It is written in *nix-style, starting from the root downwards, using slashes.

___note.description: Free text field for document-notes, made by the users

___source.description: Information about the system that has created the export.

___name.description: Name of the system that has created the export.

___version.description: Version of the system that has created the export.

___email.description: Email to contact the vendor of the system that has created the export.

___url.description: Website from the vendor of the system that has created the export.

___commentTime.description: Timestamp when the comment was added.

___commentBy.description: User who has added a comment.

___createdTime.description: Timestamp when the container was created/exported.

___createdBy.description: User who has triggered the export.

___idSystem.description: An id the system has provided for the document

___project.description: A project the document has been associated with.

___context.description: Information taken from the document content and are inherent to it.

___dueDateTime.description: A due date the document might have.

___idUser.description: An id the user can define uniquely for the document
